section.name: Movie
section.definition: Properties to describe a movie (or image sequence) stimulus.

property.name: Modality
property.definition: The stimulus modality like acoustic, haptic, visual etc.

property.name: Duration
property.definition: The duration of the stimulus in seconds.

property.name: TemporalOffset
property.definition: The temporal offset (with respect to the begin of the recorded trial) with which this stimulus was presented.

property.name: FrameRate
property.definition: The framerate with which the movie was presented.

property.name: ColorSpace
property.definition: Defines whether the movie is a monochrome, black and white, or a color movie.

property.name: OutputChannel
property.definition: The physical output device (e.g. an analog output channel, a monitor screen, the same loudspeaker, etc.). This information can be used to explicitely express that several stimuli (that share the same OutputChannel) are jointly presented.

property.name: Position
property.definition: The position of the stimulus on e.g the screen. Specified as a 2-tuple (x;y). By default this position refers to the top-left corner of the object or its bounding box.

property.name: PositionReference
property.definition: By default stimulus positions are specified by the coordinates of the top-left corner (or of the bounding box). Use this property for other definitions.

property.name: SpatialExtent
property.definition: The spatial extend of the presented stimulus (width;height) e.g. (1024;768).
